title: Avatar: Fire and Ash: How the soundtrack was made
description: Composer Simon Franglen ended up inventing instruments for tall, blue, four-fingered humanoids.
content:
It's no secret the Avatar films are a gigantic technical feat - pushing the boundaries of cinematography, animation and performance capture.
But you may not be aware that the same applies to the music.
Composer Simon Franglen says work on the third i... [6381 chars]

title: Being homeless eats away at your self-worth, says care leaver
description: A growing number of households in England have a young care leaver facing homelessness, data shows.
content:
When Klarisse Smith started living in a homeless hostel in Birmingham at the age of 16, she had been in the care system for two years.
She had spent that time moving between her foster carer, her aunt and her partner's family.
"I felt like my social ... [2941 chars]

title: Why are sperm donors having hundreds of children?
description: The European sperm market is booming, but are some donor's sperm being used to make too many babies?
content:
Some men are having vast numbers of children through sperm donation. This week the BBC reported on a man whose sperm contained a genetic mutation that dramatically raises the risk of cancer for some of his offspring.
One of the most striking aspects ... [6768 chars]

title: John Cena last match: How he reached the top of WWE
description: The man behind the "You Can't See Me" catchphrase is fighting one last time on Saturday night. But who is he, really?
content:
The Last Time Is Now. It's the name given to the tournament in which 16 wrestling giants have been competing to be the one opponent in John Cena's final fight before retirement.
And that final fight is now - Saturday night - in Washington DC, bringin... [6876 chars]

title: Cole Palmer: Chelsea forward's groin injury makes no 'sense', says Enzo Maresca
description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says there is "not any sense" to Cole Palmer's ongoing groin injury - and hopes it does not prove to be a season-long issue.
content:
Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says Cole Palmer's ongoing groin injury makes no "sense" - and hopes it does not prove to be a season-long problem.
